186038941.review:
This game is not good but it isn't terrible either.

1) There either needs to be custom operations made by the players or the designers need to make more operations. Only having 7 Operations causes a lot of repeating which can get annoying after a while. The other problem with Ops is Defense of Naval Station Newport, the map is such a pain to play because you have to go from one side of the map, back to the other side and then back again. Having the ability to choose which Ops you want to play would be extremely nice. Also subs need to have a place in operations

2) There is too much of a tier discrepancy between T8 and T9. There is no reason that after two shots from any enemy ship, I'm out of the battle. Also the pinpoint accuracy of the AI is ridiculous. I can send 20 shells at a ship and be lucky to do 40K damage yet the AI can send 5-10 shells and do the same amount of damage. For a game that strives to be fairly realistic, you guys completely whiffed on this one.

3) Matchmaking should be setup so those who use voice chat are in one server and those who don't are in a different one. Putting people who don't communicate with their team into a match with those of us who do can cause a lot of issues and often lead to mission failure.

4) Division sizes need to be increased and limits as to how many of a certain ship type can be in a division need to be removed. Allowing only 1 CV per division is stupid considering most CV fleets have more than one. Beyond that, most fleets consist of more than 7 ships.

Could be a great game if it weren't operated by bunch of brain dead designers and prokaryotic operators.
Some of the problems I find within my short game play is: 

1. Rigged matchmaking system like Warthunder; despite not knowing who's getting the winning games and functional teammates, but I have been constant losing due to my team dying out in a very short period like they're completely retarded leaving only me and some few teammates fighting. If you're playing a submarine, you're gonna get bombed by anti-sub planes with no AA support as your teammates can't understand human language. Furthermore, most of your team is just going to crowd in the back and dump rounds not doing anything until a destroyer or submarine sneaks close and take them all out. (they simply don't have the brain cells to respond, however, your enemy does)

2. Economic and research system; to be honest, the economic system is acceptable since you can still afford the repair costs, but without premium, this makes grinding very difficult like Warthunder. In other words, unless you are completely devoted into the game like an occupation or NEO-S*L*A*V*E*R*Y, this is a PAY TO PLAY GAME.

3. ASIAN SERVER, if you're an Asian who can overcome all the aforementioned issues, just don't come to the Asian Server. Most of the Asian Players are so passive that they don't respond to your message nor planning. They just simply do whatever they want to do themselves making this game basically single player deathmatch. Furthermore, even "experienced" Asian players crowd in the back with battleship and dump shells prolonging the gameplay. 

4. Poor balancing between ships; This may due to my retarded team that I've been constant getting but I find playing any other ships besides Battleships very difficult since if you play a cruiser or a destroyer, a single round of salvo from a battleship or a sneaky submarine can take you out while your team is dumping sh*t. If you're playing a submarine, you're gonna get bomb by anti-sub planes while no anti-air is provided since your team is dumping sh*t. If you're playing an Aircraft carrier, you would be able to harass enemy with planes, but eventually you're gonna find you team gone with you and few left since your team is killed while they're dumping sh*t.

Overall, this game is rigged, poorly balanced, financially exploitative, and full of retards. 
JUST STAY AS FAR AS POSSIBLE, IT IS A PIECE OF SH*T ITSELF.

Si estás to cachondo y te apetece marcarte tremenda reverencia, este juego no es para ti churrita. Esto es pa los ramdoms NPCs que tienen los pelo largo y que tienen en el ombligo la jungla de cristal que son más inútiles que los frenos de un barco. Hablando de Barcos, tremendo transatlántico que tiene mi colega el nivel 9000. Bro llevas 40000 horas pegate un duchao anda que me voy a cagar en toda tu puta madre y en todos tus putos muertos. Estás to tranquilito tomando el Sol en tu barco y te viene chico torpedo con to tus muertos hijo de la gran puta. 

La calidad de los barco y los gráficos es excepcional, muy adecuados al contexto histórico. 10/10. Se ve muy bien reflejado la vuelta de los Borbones a España tras el golpe de estado del general Pavía. La tecnología es increíble para el momento y la verdad que se agradece un juego que se esmere en hacer unos diseños adecuados y no las reverendas mierdas de barcos que hay por ejemplo en el Call of Duty Cold War. 

Atte. Juan Carlos Lozano. (no soy panchito)

185716241.review:
作为一名玩了7年《坦克世界闪击战》的老玩家，我对于这次的版本更新感到无比的失望和寒心。
首游戏菜单的画风被大幅修改，变得奇怪且不协调，这与游戏原本的写实风格大相径庭。这种改变不仅没有提升游戏体验，反而让我感到十分不适。
科技树的改动也让我无法接受。原本清晰、有条理的科技树被大幅修改，导致我在选择升级路线时感到十分困惑。这种改动不仅破坏了游戏的平衡性，也严重影响了我的游戏体验。
让令人无法接受的是，新版本中加入了奇怪的指挥官角色。这些指挥官不仅外观奇特，而且技能设置也显得非常突兀，完全不符合游戏的整体风格。这种改动让我感到非常失望，因为我觉得游戏开发者并没有真正听取玩家的意见和建议。
这次的版本更新让我对游戏的未来充满了担忧。作为一款陪伴我多年的游戏，我希望游戏开发者能够尊重玩家的意见，保持游戏的原汁原味，而不是一味地追求新奇和变化。如果游戏继续朝着这个方向发展，我恐怕将不得不考虑放弃这款曾经深爱的游戏。
希望游戏开发者能够认真对待玩家的反馈，尽快做出调整，让游戏重新回归正轨。

185612508.review:
Played this game for about 7 hours so far. Out of the 7 hours I have, I have enjoyed this game about 6.5 hours. There are some times where I just sit about watching the combat on the seas so I still get the stars and credits, but other than those few minutes, the rest of the game is amazing. 

What I like most about the game (aside from the actual naval warfare) is the fact that everything "premium" in the game can be achieved for free with enough time and dedication. I have less than 8 hours in the game and I am already access rank 15, sailing with a tier 5 ship. The progress that can be made with just a bit of dedication is astounding, and goes to show the craftsmanship of the game. 

9/10, would recommend, have recommended, will recommend.

185476230.review:
This game is just a cash-grab from the producers. You have to read the fine print on all events because more often than not, they put in little print that you have to use doubloons in order to actually complete the event. If you haven't been able to acquire them the rare time they give them out, then you have to pay out of pocket. If you don't pay for the premium subscription to get the experience bonus, leveling a ship and commander is a grind like no other. You could pay doubloons equivalent to ~$75 to purchase the unique ships that outperform the earned ships. You can pay ~$5 for a unique commander that has more skills than regular commanders. You could use coal but even if you are in a high level clan with coal bonuses, it's still a really tough grind. Everything about the game screams use real money or suffer a lengthy and painful grind against the players who do spend real money. If you don't do your due research before you choose a line you likely will go down a path and waste a lot of time on a flop ship that has no viability in battle. 

TL;DR - The game is a money dump if you want to be proficient and they hide a lot of details in the fine print of their events. I've never played a game that offers events but actually hides the details that completing the event costs real money.

185326646.review: This is a really cool game, I have played World of Warships legends on the Playstation and it was good fun. This version for PC's is even more fun as it has more options to choose from in how you play, as well as the option of using submarines (  Not available in the console gaming arena. :(  ), thus allowing the use of depth charges to hunt them down (  Also not available in console gaming. ). The ship levels are also higher as WOW Ledgends only goes to level VIII then Legendary, where as this version goes to level X then legendary. So overall as good as the console version is, this PC version is even better due to the bigger choices in choosing ships overall, as well as subs. Add to that more game options while playing, just makes this a great game to play. Also game controls for all versions are relatively simple to use.All of this makes the the game fun to play, simple to play or if you like a good challenge you can take on the more seasoned players at the higher tier levels, or in ranked and fleet matches allowing for some very interesting sometimes hectic gaming. This game is a lot of fun and I absolutely recommend having a go at it. Big ships, big guns, a bit of strategy and team work allowing for some BIG FUN. Give it a go I'm sure you won't be disappointed and you will have a lot of fun.  :)

185032971.review:
World of Warships: Wenn deine Träume sinken, bevor du es tust.

World of Warships ist der perfekte Simulator für alle, die schon immer wissen wollten, wie es sich anfühlt, in einem schwimmenden Sarg herumzuschippern, während du von einem unsichtbaren Gegner zu Schrott geschossen wirst. Es kombiniert die majestätische Eleganz von Kriegsschiffen mit dem bitteren Nachgeschmack, dass du das Spielprinzip erst dann verstehst, wenn du schon dreimal in Flammen aufgegangen bist.  

Das Gameplay? Großartig, wenn du Geduld hast – oder einen Hang dazu, dir selbst beim Versagen zuzusehen. Du fährst majestätisch über die Karte, ein wahres Monument der Macht und Stärke, nur um festzustellen, dass du geradewegs in einen Torpedoschwarm segelst, der aussieht wie ein missglückter Lasertanz. Die erste Lektion des Spiels: Große Schiffe mögen beeindruckend sein, aber sie sind so wendig wie ein betrunkener Blauwal.  

Deine Teamkollegen? Eine inspirierende Ansammlung von strategischen Genies, die entweder alle zusammen in eine Ecke der Karte flüchten oder wie die Titanic direkt auf den Feind losfahren – ohne Eisberg, aber mit genauso viel Drama. „Pushen wir?“ fragst du, nur um zu sehen, wie dein Team sich rückwärts aus der Gefahrenzone bewegt, während du alleine gegen drei Kreuzer stehst, die dich wie ein All-you-can-eat-Buffet zerlegen.  

Die Gegner? Unsichtbare Dämonen. Zerstörer, die aus dem Nebel auftauchen wie Geister der Hölle, oder Flugzeugträger, die dich aus sicherer Entfernung mit Bomben eindecken, während sie Popcorn essen. Nichts bringt mehr Freude, als einem Schlachtschiff zuzusehen, das von einem Flugzeugträger zerlegt wird, während es verzweifelt versucht, sich zu drehen – ein episches Duell zwischen „zu spät bemerkt“ und „niemals eine Chance gehabt“.  

Die Grafik? Atemberaubend. Jeder Sonnenuntergang über dem Ozean erinnert dich daran, dass dein Schiff bald im Wasser ruht. Die Explosionen sehen aus, als hätte Michael Bay sie persönlich inszeniert – und sie sind genauso häufig, weil du wahrscheinlich jede Runde selbst einer bist.  

Fazit: World of Warships ist wie ein romantischer Segeltörn mit einem Hauch von Feuerwerk – nur, dass das Feuerwerk dein Schiff ist. Es ist brutal, gnadenlos und genau das, was du brauchst, wenn du deinen inneren Kapitän quälen willst. Fünf von fünf „Warum bin ich schon wieder in den Torpedo gelaufen?“ – jetzt mit extra viel Salz und Rauch!

The game is so much fun because of its tactical and realistic nature. There are so many options as far as vessels go, that you will find countless hours of enjoyable game time. The hardest part is the leveling and unlocking. But since there are so many free gifts available all the time and matches do not take long to load or play, you will find that the grind is not the worst among games out there.

The matchmaking is fair. Even after 30 hours of game time under the belt, I still have not run into an outrageously unfair match. They balance it pretty well by keeping ship levels around the same. You might run into a level higher or lower but it is not a drastic difference. Plus, it adds to the bragging rights when you take down a higher ship.

I even recently started playing with a group of other players. We join a division and jump right into the action. It is a fun experience for sure. Most importantly, you cannot be the price tag of free. I highly recommend this to others if you are looking for some free easy playing game.

184924862.review:
This is a game which you play every now and then and it will be a great time pass. With regular updates and balancing it is always changing and improving and it seems players love the updates.

However, there are a few areas where clarity and communication from the developers could be improved for new players to maximize enjoyment.

-Key Points for Improvement:
1- Clarity on "Battle On" After Death
One of the most important features that new players should know is the ability to press the Escape key after being sunk, which brings up the option to "Battle On." This allows you to leave the match without waiting for the end, while still earning full XP for your performance. It wasn’t clear to me at first, and I initially thought staying until the end was necessary to receive rewards. This small change in guidance would save a lot of confusion for new players.

2-Missions and Rewards Visibility
While the missions system adds a lot of variety and incentives, the game does a poor job of making it clear that specific rewards are earned for completing certain missions. The missions screen feels like a side note, and I only realized the potential rewards after exploring it myself later. A clearer indication or tutorial on this feature would be very helpful.

3-Nation-Specific Ship Types
The game’s encouragement to try ships from various nations is a smart way to keep players engaged and versatile. However, it would be immensely helpful if the game provided an overview of each nation’s ship types and their strengths/weaknesses upfront. This would help players make informed decisions when spending XP to research ships, avoiding unnecessary frustration.

Here’s a quick rundown of the nations and their ship characteristics:

USA:

Type: Balanced ships with reliable performance.
Pros: Strong AA defense, good at multi-role gameplay.
Cons: Mid-tier speed and armor.
Japan:

Type: Torpedo specialists with stealth advantages.
Pros: Long-range torpedoes, excellent cruisers and destroyers.
Cons: Weak AA defense, fragile ships.
Germany:

Type: Hard-hitting battleships and cruisers.
Pros: Strong armor and powerful guns.
Cons: Torpedoes are less effective compared to other nations.
USSR:

Type: Dominates at long-range engagements.
Pros: High damage output and fast ships.
Cons: Limited stealth and maneuverability.
UK:

Type: Versatile ships with focus on utility.
Pros: Specialized HE shells and repair consumables.
Cons: Relatively lower speed and firepower.
France:

Type: Speed and maneuverability-focused.
Pros: Excellent mobility and fast-firing guns.
Cons: Mediocre armor and torpedoes.
Italy:

Type: Unique semi-armor-piercing shells.
Pros: Balanced performance with good mid-range power.
Cons: Less effective AA capabilities.
This kind of information would help newer players avoid wasting XP on ships that don’t align with their playstyle.

4-Clarity on Dispersion and Aiming
Another critical area where clarity is needed is around dispersion mechanics and how they differ for each ship and nation. Dispersion directly affects where shells land relative to where you're aiming, and each ship handles this differently. For instance, American battleships often have tighter dispersion at mid-range, while German ships excel in brawling with better accuracy up close. This variability in aiming can be frustrating if players aren’t aware of these differences beforehand. A tutorial or in-game guide on dispersion and how it varies by ship and nation would go a long way in helping players adjust and aim effectively.

5-Premium Rewards Are a Great Touch
I absolutely love the occasional rewards like premium account days and doubloons given as part of achievements or events. These small perks make the grind feel worthwhile and keep players motivated to progress further.

184656476.review:
When I first tried out World of Warships, I was drawn in by the promise of commanding massive warships in epic naval battles. The game certainly delivers on scale and spectacle, but after spending some time with it, I found it to be a mixed experience.

Starting with the positives, the game’s attention to detail is truly impressive. The warships are beautifully designed, with intricate models that make each vessel feel unique. The combat mechanics can be thrilling, especially when you’re in the heat of a tactical battle, carefully positioning your ship and timing your attacks. The game also offers a variety of ship types and nations to explore, adding some depth and replayability.

However, the sheer size of the game can be a bit overwhelming. From the massive download size to the complexity of the systems, it feels like a game that demands a significant time investment just to get started. Navigating menus and understanding the progression system is not as intuitive as I’d hoped, and it can be hard to figure out what to do next.

While the simulation aspect is well-executed, it also makes the gameplay slower than I expected. I was hoping for more fast-paced, arcade-like naval action, but instead, the battles are more methodical, which might not appeal to everyone.

That said, World of Warships does shine when you’re fully immersed in a team-based battle and working strategically to outmaneuver opponents. The moments when everything clicks are genuinely rewarding.

In the end, World of Warships is a game that excels in realism and detail but might not be for everyone. If you’re a fan of naval simulations and have the time to dive into its complex systems, you’ll likely enjoy the experience. For more casual players like me, it might feel like a bit of a slow sail.

184146576.review: A solid arcade style 3D battleship game. There are many aspects of this game that make it outstanding, and some that are controversial, some outright bad. The maps are well crafted and provide a solid backdrop for a good time. Unfortunately, aircraft carriers are poorly balanced, and submarines are more of an annoyance than they are a contribution to team based gameplay. Aside from those two things and seemingly endless greed from Wargaming, this game can provide you endless hours of fun. The art department deserve some of the highest praise of anything in the game, providing exquisite detail, even when imagination is used for some of the theoretical concept ships never built. The audio is fantastic, physics and ballistics are top notch beside a few persistent bugs. Overall, this is an excellent, and one of the only, good water-based combat games in existence. Give it a shot! It's free to play and most of the best ships only consume time as the resource, you've got not much else to lose.

183658487.review:
World of Warships brings the intensity of naval combat to life with stunning visuals, deep strategic gameplay, and a large variety of ships and tactics to explore. The game allows you to take command of some of history's most iconic warships, from battleships to aircraft carriers, each offering a unique playstyle and set of challenges.

The most exciting part of World of Warships is the battles themselves. Every encounter is filled with tension as you coordinate with your teammates, plan your moves, and try to outsmart your opponents. The action is intense, with massive explosions, precise aiming, and tactical decision-making. Whether you prefer staying at long range with a battleship or engaging in close-quarters combat with a destroyer, there’s a playstyle for everyone.

The game also offers a strong sense of progression, as you unlock new ships, upgrades, and skills that improve your naval prowess. The progression system is rewarding, allowing you to customize your ships and adapt your strategy as you rise through the ranks.

Visually, the game is stunning, with beautifully rendered ships, realistic water effects, and vast ocean maps that add to the immersion. The sound design also adds to the atmosphere, with realistic gunfire, ship engines, and the roar of waves crashing.

If you’re a fan of tactical combat games or enjoy naval warfare, World of Warships is a game that offers hours of fun and strategy. It’s a must-play for anyone who enjoys large-scale battles with a mix of action and thoughtful planning.
